name: 地球化學
restrict: ◎限大三大四 ◎限碩一碩二碩三以上修習
description: This course will be an introduction to the chemical processes that influence the solid Earth system. The application of chemistry to rocks offers important insight into igneous, metamorphic and sedimentary processes such as the differentiation of the Earth, thermodynamics, mineral formation and stability and the formation of mineral deposits. Further topics will include the use of radiogenic and stable isotopes in geochronology, the carbon cycle and life on Earth. The students will explore through a series of lectures and laboratory assignments novel methods which can help to understand the Earth’s natural environment
goals: An introduction to the chemical processes that influence the solid Earth system.
syllabus:
Week 1    Introduction to geochemistry/Origin of elements

Week 2    Chemical Differentiation of the Earth

Week 3    Properties of Elements (i.e. chemical bonding, ionic radii)

Week 4    Element Transport

Week 5    Geochronology

Week 6    Radiogenic Isotopes

Week 7    Stable Isotopes

Week 8    Mid-term exam

Week 9    Geochemical Cycles

Week 10  Environments

Week 11  Geochemistry in Sedimentary Petrology

Week 12  Geochemistry in Metamorphic Petrology

Week 13  Geochemistry in Igneous Petrology

Week 14  Class presentations

Week 15  Class presentations

Week 16 Final Exam
